She hugs him. He glances back. A tractor-trailer plows through the rental car, tearing it to pieces. Sandy stands motionless with his gaze fixed on the wreckage. Sandy looks at her and softly nods. Later, he drives the beat-up van along a narrow dirt road. In an office, Big Chuck sits across from Marisol and Julian. Big Chuck's smile fades. Chuck eyes the thugs. Julian slams Chuck's head against the desk. Diana searches the van. The temperature gauge rises. Sandy pulls over as steam wafts from the hood. Sandy steps out and approaches the steaming hood as Diana duct tapes the unconscious skiptracer. She takes a sip. She touches his pecs. Her nose grazes his beard. Sandy props the hood open and lets steam vent out. He stares at the sign, then opens the van. The skiptracer breathes deeply in his duct tape restraint. Now, a state trooper waves on traffic past Sandy's wrecked sedan. As Julian and Marisol cruise by, they overhear a witness. Now, Sandy talks on his cell as he and Diana walk along a deserted road. He shoots Diana a look. She looks away. At night, a pickup truck approaches. Her thumbs. He shows her his phone. Later, they start a fire. He looks up and she shuts her eyes. Sandy shrugs. Sandy lies on his side next to the fire, and Diana snuggles up behind him. She pulls her arm away. A snake slithers toward them. The snake moves closer. He glances back at Diana as the snake slithers into his pants. He springs up and fumbles with his jeans. He pushes his pants off. Sandy tosses his jeans into the woods. A snake lowers from a tree. It drops onto his shoulders. She dips the stick into the fire. She swings the stick. The snake tightens around his neck. The snake watches the flame, then bites into Sandy's neck. Diana whacks it with a stick, and Sandy drops to the ground. She hits it a few more times, then tosses away the stick. Diana grabs the snake and tugs at it, as Sandy pries the reptile's teeth from his neck. Diana tosses the snake away and shakes her hands. In the morning, a cargo train passes by a rusty disheveled station. Diana applies makeup while Sandy lies on a bench in a pair of dirt-covered khakis. Sandy wakes up and reaches for his neck. Diana watches him with a smile. He walks away. He moves to the ticket booth. He looks back at Diana and paces.

The temperature gauge on the dashboard begins to climb, prompting Sandy to pull over to the side of the road as steam starts to waft from the hood. He steps out of the van and approaches the source of the steam, while Diana busies herself with duct-taping the unconscious skiptracer. She pauses to take a sip from a bottle, then reaches out to touch Sandy's pecs, her nose brushing against his beard. Sandy props the hood open, allowing the steam to vent out into the air. Meanwhile, a state trooper directs traffic past Sandy's wrecked sedan, waving cars along the road. As Julian and Marisol drive by, they catch snippets of a witness's account. He glances back as a tractor-trailer, a massive vehicle typically used for transporting large quantities of goods, plows through the rental car, tearing it to pieces. Sandy stands motionless with his gaze fixed on the wreckage of the vehicle he had rented from the town’s only car service. Sandy looks at her and softly nods, signaling a silent understanding. Later, he drives the beat-up van, a relic from the late 1980s, along a narrow dirt road lined with towering pines. In an office downtown, Big Chuck, a local crime boss known for his ruthless dealings, sits across from Marisol and Julian. Big Chuck's smile fades into a grimace. Chuck eyes the thugs, hardened men who have been his enforcers for years. Julian, known for his volatile temper, slams Chuck's head against the desk, demonstrating his dominance. Diana searches the van frantically for a first aid kit. The temperature gauge rises, indicating engine trouble, so Sandy pulls over as steam wafts from the hood, a common issue with the van due to a leaky radiator. Sandy steps out and approaches the steaming hood as Diana duct tapes the unconscious skiptracer, ensuring he won't escape. She takes a sip from a flask she carries for courage. She touches his pecs, feeling his heartbeat, as her nose grazes his beard that he hasn't shaved in days. Sandy props the hood open, letting steam vent out and cool the engine. He stares at the sign for an upcoming highway, realizing they need to keep moving, then opens the van. The skiptracer breathes deeply in his duct tape restraint, struggling against his bonds. Now, a state trooper waves on traffic past Sandy's wrecked sedan, which had been reported stolen. As Julian and Marisol cruise by, they overhear a witness recounting the chaotic scene. Now, Sandy talks on his cell to a contact who might help them, as he and Diana walk along a deserted road lined with tumbleweeds. He shoots Diana a look, silently telling her to be cautious. She looks away, understanding the gravity of their situation. At night, a pickup truck approaches, its headlights illuminating their path. Her thumbs, which ache from hours of gripping the steering wheel, massage the tension away. He shows her his phone, revealing a message from an ally. Later, they start a fire, using dry branches to keep warm. He looks up into the starry sky, and she shuts her eyes, weary from their journey. Sandy shrugs, resigned to their fate. Sandy lies on his side next to the fire, and Diana snuggles up behind him, seeking warmth against the chilly night. She pulls her arm away as a snake, native to this part of the country, slithers toward them. The snake moves closer, its scales glistening in the firelight. He glances back at Diana as the snake slithers into his pants, causing him to spring up and fumble with his jeans. He pushes his pants off, desperate to rid himself of the creature. Sandy tosses his jeans into the woods, not caring about their loss. A snake lowers from a tree, its eyes fixed on him. It drops onto his shoulders, startling him. She dips the stick into the fire, intending to use it as a torch. She swings the stick, aiming to frighten the snake. The snake tightens around his neck, sensing prey. The snake watches the flame, then bites into Sandy's neck, injecting venom. Diana whacks it with a stick, and Sandy drops to the ground, gasping for air. She hits it a few more times, then tosses away the stick, which is now charred from the fire. Diana grabs the snake and tugs at it, as Sandy pries the reptile's teeth from his neck, fighting the pain. Diana tosses the snake away and shakes her hands, trembling from the adrenaline. In the morning, a cargo train passes by a rusty, disheveled station that hasn't been operational for years. Diana applies makeup while Sandy lies on a bench in a pair of dirt-covered khakis, which are the only clothes he has left. Sandy wakes up and reaches for his neck, feeling the bandaged wound. Diana watches him with a smile, relieved he's recovering. He walks away, contemplating their next move. He moves to the ticket booth, hoping to buy a ticket with the little cash they have. He looks back at Diana and paces, torn between staying with her and continuing their dangerous journey alone.

In the morning, a trolley coasts by a rusty abandoned warehouse. Rachel applies moisturizer while Taylor rests on a bench in a pair of dust-covered jeans. Taylor awakens and reaches for his shoulder. Rachel observes him with a grin. He wanders away. He proceeds to the snack stand. He looks back at Rachel and circles.

Ink dribbles from her chin. She pats him. He peers back. A bulldozer crashes through the bicycle, shredding it to bits. Sandy stands immobile with his gaze locked on the debris. test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Sandy sees a groggy skiptracer beside a wheel and Diana, bleeding, rushes to him. A tractor-trailer destroys the rental car as Sandy stands motionless. Later, Sandy drives a van while Big Chuck faces trouble in an office with Marisol and Julian. Diana searches the van as it overheats, and Sandy deals with the hood as Diana ties the skiptracer. A state trooper directs traffic past Sandy's wrecked sedan, and Diana and Sandy walk along a deserted road. They start a fire at night, and a snake enters Sandy's pants, then attacks him. Diana saves him by using a stick, eventually tossing the snake away. In the morning, a train passes a rusty station where Diana applies makeup and Sandy, waking up, touches his neck. He walks toward the ticket booth, looking back at Diana who watches with a smile.
